intro: Ononis alba subsp. alba, commonly known as white restharrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, rocky areas, and disturbed sites.
